alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Cedar; Knox; Pierce; Thurston; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:39PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne, Pierce, northern Antelope, southeastern Knox, northwestern Thurston and Cedar Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 538 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles south of Wakefield to 7 miles north of Neligh. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Emerson around 545 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bloomfield, Wausa, Crofton, Hartington, Fordyce, Wynot and St. Helena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Antelope; Cedar; Knox; Pierce; Thurston; Wayne
